page.title: 11Doodle Bug on Dedworth cont.
page.content: "It's all right Sal" said my father in a very worried voice, still pedalling along. The Doodle Bug grew smaller and lower into the distance. The sight of the swings dispelled my fears as the noise grew fainter and I tugged my father' coat asking for a ride. My words were lost and never heard amidst the terrific bang which shook the ground beneath us. Sheer terror gripped me as I clung to my father who just stopped pedalling. I thought the world had stopped especially when my father said nothing. Then as if someone had turned on a switch once more we were pedalling again, but with urgent haste this time. As we zoomed along doing twice our previous pace there was a big column of smoke. I realised something terrible had happened and my Dad was needed as he was and Air Raid Warden.
